alert.note: Alert for City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Prince George; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 5:08PM EDT until July 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in south central Virginia, City of Petersburg, Dinwiddie and Prince George. In southeast Virginia, Surry and Sussex. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Petersburg, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, Waverly, Disputanta, Fort Lee, Prince George, Sussex, Stony Creek, Carson, Homeville, Garysville, Ettrick, Matoaca, Burrowsville, Cabin Point, Templeton, Prince George Golf, New Bohemia and Reams. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Prince George; Surry; Sussex
